bug.short_desc: Improve (or remove) the logic behind the Atom show property computation

long_desc.thetext:
In correlation with bug http://bugzilla.qooxdoo.org/show_bug.cgi?id=8004 , the Atom "show" property determination should be improved. Today, it defaults to "both" as stated in the doc, but calling the Atom constructor with only "label" or only "icon" switches the "show" property respectively to "label" or "icon".
For istance, when the setIcon() method is called after the Atom is constructed with only a label, the icon never appear because the "show" property sticks to "label" instead of switching back to "both".
In the comments, Christopher suggested to improve the "show" computation the following way :
"""""" I would propose, to change the "label" "icon" "both" mode, when setIcon or setLabel was called.
For example:
"label" mode setIcon(x) switch automatically to "both" mode
"icon" mode setLabel(x) switch automatically to "both" mode """"""
This would solve the problem, but I'm not very keen on "half-computed" properties, i.e. properties you can set explicitly, but that can change automagically.
I would suggest to let the developer decide alone for the "show" property value, but the Atom would detect unassigned "label" or "icon" property, and render accordingly based on its "show" property. AFAICT, this is how works the desktop version of the Atom.
